data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can never go backwards unless you start from the beginning. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right turns you away from the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Take 4 steps and turn around. Take 6 steps and take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are in the exact same place you started then take the same number of steps you took at the beginning in reverse order, then repeat that sequence. So, the answer is yes.

Take 15 steps once you return to the starting point. Take 3 steps once you go back to start. Take 3 steps once you start again. So, the answer is no.

Turning right gives you a 10 step back to the start. Take 7 steps and turn around. Take 7 steps and turn around for a 10 step back. To go back to the starting point, you have to turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around for a 10 step back, then turn around for a 14 step back. So, the answer is no.

Your starting point is going back 6 steps. Your start is going 8 steps. Your end is going 2 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you cannot take 1 step backward. If you only took 3 steps forward, you could only take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Follow the instructions to take 6 steps left. Taking 9 steps left and 3 steps left is the same as 6 steps left. To take 9 steps left, take 10 steps left. To take 3 steps left, take 1 step left. To take 3 steps right, take 4 steps right. Thus, the answer is No.

A person who faces forward should always face forward. The answer: yes.

This is an incorrect way of orienting oneself. If you always face forward, you tend to take more straight steps in the same direction. The starting point will eventually end. So, the answer is Yes.

In the second sequence you always face forward with seven steps left, two steps right, eight steps left, and nine steps forward. If you always face forward, you will always be following the direction you want to move in. If you always face backward, you will always be going in the direction you want to go, which means you want to go in the direction of your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Facing the same direction, you can not move forward unless you face the same direction. The first step is always straight forward. The third step has to be taken backward in order to get back in position forward. The fourth step has to be taken backward in order to get back up and continue forward. So, the answer is No.
